channel.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
channel.description: Hello moparscape, yea yea i know portfowarding is easy and all but my wireless router is being incredibly stupid and it wont allow me to open the port.For anyone about to flame on me GTFO! It's not my fault its the router's.I am too broke to afford another one so i need someone to open the port for me.Thank you for any useful info.You will be rewarded with donater status and or get payed the first donation.Its a really stupid problem and its blocking me from completing the rsps.Im sure with alot of dedication it will be fine.Im not sure if im aloud to post the website url but here it goes... : Runerank.ucoz.org (If moderator complains i will be happy to take off and post in advertisements when online.) I already have a no-ip and everything.

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @1st 1st
item.description:
@1st wrote:

Lol yeah its incredibly stupid…I checked everything its a torvapkz base lol so what ever. Ill get someone to host for me.But im not sure witch section would be appropriate…

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

I’m just going to change the ip that my client connects to. It’ll be faster and easier.
sec

#EDIT#

  • Sorry dude, can’t connect. Did you try doing what I said about Duc?

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @1st 1st
item.description:
@1st wrote:

Lmfao!!! ok well go on runerank.ucoz.org my client is there for download under client download. just try logging in.
And thank you for your time

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

Make sure you downloaded duc 3.0 from the no-ip website or what ever its called.
Just look for duc download on the page and make sure its running.
It should work, if you link me i could try logging into your server.
Maybe, im meant to be doing physics… hahaha

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @1st 1st
item.description:
@1st wrote:

Yes i keep getting that message.I assumed it was because i didnt portfoward correctly.But i have second thoughts now… If it helps you solve my problem faster i changed my clients ip from 127.0.0.1 to runerank.no-ip.org.Witch is the current ip for my server.So maybe others can log in but i cant.There is no way of me knowing since i dont want to advertise a rsps that im not even sure its online…Thanks for your reply btw

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

You said in your first post that it wasn’t allowing you to open your port?
From what you described in your second post, it seems to be working fine.

  • Is it just saying, ‘error connecting to server’ when you try log in?

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @1st 1st
item.description:
@1st wrote:

I overlooked this hundreds of times before posting so i literally have no idea of what i could be doing wrong.Btw my router is a “SMC8014W-G” wireless router.And yes my port is set to 43594.
It is set to port range tcp/udp or what ever and is active.My firewall is disabled atm so i dont think its that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Need help PortForwarding [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

What exactly is your router doing?

  • Are you sure you’re loging into your default gateway?

Also make sure port 43594 is unblocked in firewall. This could be your problem.
Sorry if this is unclear.

Read full topic
